description_txt: stated on June 23, 2011 in a newsletter.:
quote_txt: Under Ryan plan, "those 54 and younger would receive the same kind of healthcare options now enjoyed by members of Congress."

description_txt: stated on July 14, 2011 in an interview with the 'New Hampshire Business Review":
quote_txt: "New Mexico is the second Hollywood" because of tax incentives for the film industry.

description_txt: stated on July 9, 2011 in a television interview:
quote_txt: "95 percent of teachers and principals are not implicated in the [Atlanta Public Schools cheating scandal] report at all."

description_txt: stated on July 5, 2011 in a tweet on Twitter:
quote_txt: "POTUS’ economists: ‘Stimulus’ Has Cost $278,000 per job."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2011 in a forum.:
quote_txt: Says Texas is the only state that exempts jet fuel from its state motor fuels tax.

description_txt: stated on July 8, 2011 in a press release from Assembly Speaker Sheila Oliver (D-Essex):
quote_txt: "Numerous studies have shown that these so-called right-to-work laws do not generate jobs and economic growth."

description_txt: stated on July 14, 2011 in a television ad:
quote_txt: "Our country's got this huge debt, and (President Barack) Obama says raise taxes and keep spending more."

description_txt: stated on June 22, 2011 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: Says a quote at the top of the redesigned website for the Department of Justice comes from a socialist who wanted to impose global common law.

description_txt: stated on July 8, 2011 in a campaign flier:
quote_txt: Says state Sen. Sheila Harsdorf wants to "eliminate Medicare" as we know it.

description_txt: stated on July 1, 2011 in a blog posting:
quote_txt: House Bill 2301 never had a public hearing

description_txt: stated on June 15, 2011 in a speech in the Ohio Senate:
quote_txt: "State agencies have not identified one single instance where groundwater has been damaged due to hydraulic fracking."

description_txt: stated on July 6, 2011 in an interview on NPR’s “Tell Me More” with Michel Martin:
quote_txt: Says for the first time in the history of the United States, the government cut taxes during wartime

description_txt: stated on July 12, 2011 in an interview with CBS News:
quote_txt: Social Security and other federal checks may not go out on Aug. 3 if the debt ceiling is not increased.

description_txt: stated on June 29, 2011 in a posting on Twitter:
quote_txt: Florida’s proposed Health Care Freedom Act "will allow Floridians to opt out of Obama’s govt. takeover of healthcare!"

description_txt: stated on July 7, 2011 in an interview with CBS:
quote_txt: "From now on, we have to pay the Russians $50 million an astronaut to send Americans to the space station"

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2011 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: Says scientists are "in dispute" over whether being gay is a choice.

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2011 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "There's no scientific conclusion that (being gay) is genetic."

description_txt: stated on June 25, 2011 in a newspaper column and other statements:
quote_txt: Says new GOP Wisconsin Assembly members "voted to take funding away from their public schools in their districts to give it to private Milwaukee voucher schools."

description_txt: stated on June 29, 2011 in a House debate over mandatory seat belt use:
quote_txt: "There are 30,000 people that have been killed with seat belts."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • July 13, 2011

description_txt: stated on July 6, 2011 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "The [Georgia] General Assembly took away the Atlanta Board of Education’s oversight of the superintendent."

description_txt: stated on July 7, 2011 in a television commercial:
quote_txt: Since President Obama took office, "2 million jobs. Gone."

description_txt: stated on July 11, 2011 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "As we've seen that federal support for states diminish, you've seen the biggest job losses in the public sector -- teachers, police officers, firefighters losing their jobs."

description_txt: stated on June 30, 2011 in a debate:
quote_txt: "I sponsored and was the co-sponsor of the only legislation that ever passed that had E-Verify provisions in it back in 2010 when I served in the Legislature."

description_txt: stated on July 1, 2011 in an e-mail to state employees:
quote_txt: "A recent study revealed that, across the nation, taxes would have to be increased by an average of $1,300 a year just to support the currently unsustainable public employee pension systems. In Florida, that dollar figure translates to $813 a year."

description_txt: stated on June 24, 2011 in a speech at Dartmouth College:
quote_txt: For people in the top 1 percent for income, "your effective tax burden is in the low 20s, the lowest it’s been in decades and decades and decades -- lower than somebody who might make substantially less money."

description_txt: stated on June 29, 2011 in a press release from Sen. Steve Oroho (R-Sussex):
quote_txt: Because of Democratic tax hikes, New Jersey ended a decade with fewer private sector jobs for the first time in recorded history.

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2011 in an interview with "Newsweek":
quote_txt: Slim Jims "just recently" cost 99 cents but now cost $2.69.

description_txt: stated on July 11, 2011 in a "New York Times" column:
quote_txt: "There are actually half a million fewer government employees now than there were when (President Barack) Obama took office."

description_txt: stated on June 21, 2011 in Bill-signing ceremony:
quote_txt: "Our crime rate continues to plummet."

description_txt: stated on June 23, 2011 in a blog post:
quote_txt: Former Atlanta Public Schools Superintendent Beverly Hall left the school district "significantly better than she found it."
